Harvard students alumni we'll get to test to find a case to go to trial this month that alleges the college discriminates against Asian American applicants from member station WBUR GBH in Boston Kirk Carapezza reports a federal judge in Boston made the decision in court today
The group suing Harvard students for fair admissions had tried to block students and alumni from taking the stand saying their perspective was not relevant
Federal judge Alison boroughs dismiss that idea and granted eight of them the right to testify
They're expected to support the value of diversity on the other side students for fair admissions says none of the anonymous Asian American plaintiffs suing Harvard are prepared to testify the college held them to higher standards and unfairly denied them that mission the trial begins October fifteenth for NPR News I'm Kirk Carapezza in Boston
New government study is finding one in three adults eat fast food on any given day roughly eighty five million people the Centers for Disease Control and prevention released the numbers today those findings are based on the survey of around ten thousand adults
So he found little difference between men and women but it did find that higher income families ate fast food more than lower income families

Welcome back to live at the Linda featuring stellar young from march of two thousand Thirteen useless cancer march two thousand sixteen Olivia Coolio from September two thousand Fifteen and bill Skinner from September two thousand Seventeen
You were just listening to the useless cans opening set supporting hawk club of cow town from march to thousands sixteen last but not least we have still young opening set supporting Graham Alexander from march to thousands Thirteen a unique blend of atmosphere indie rock and upbeat post punk
Still young has been one of Albany New York's premier indie rock acts for the better part of a decade
The Albany New York based group features John Glen on vocals and keys Eric Flora on guitar and vocals Kyle hatch on lead guitar Dave Parker on base and Tim Broad and then on drums
Together the members work to create the most accurate portrayal of key moments in life that everyone understands but often can explain
With two full length LPs numerous e P releases the band has consistently provided their fans with new material and captivating live shows
Keep up with stellar Young's latest music news and show announcements on stellar young dot com so enjoy stellar Young's opening set supporting Graham Alexander recorded live at the window on march twenty nine two thousand Thirteen [noise]
